Title: Wow!
Cons: Haven't found where to set the resolution for taking pictures. Eats batteries fast. Would like a better microphone for video capturing.
Pros: Takes good pictures. Takes good video. User Interface is easy to use
Comments: Bought this camera before I went on Spring break vacation and I am happy with it so far. I actually paid $149.99 USD for this camera and $24.99 for the PNY 2gb SD card. I love this camera. I mainly use this for video capturing, cause that is one of my hobbys. But I will purchase a video camera for that.

Title: Batteries issue easily solved
Cons:
Had issue with batteries. It would say "replace batteries" almost instantly (in about 30 sec) after putting new batteries in.

No widescreen video (but hey, what do you expect for this price? Just basic features, right?)
Pros:
Cheap camera that takes good pictures.

RMA service was easy and Canon didnt even need any RMA numbers or requests> Just send the camera in with receipt copy and with a short description whats wrong. I Got the camera back already fixed in less than a week. Works good now (still learning how to use it, though)
Comments: I havent had much time to use the camera, I am still learning how to use it. Once I put a couple more months of use on it, I will write a better review.

Title: Excelent Camera
Cons: Sometimes does not flash when it should but does much better than my Kodak p850.
Pros: Does very well with capabilities. Good zoom operation. Good clarity on photos and flash does quite well. Even survived dropping in the snow and getting wet. Face recognition does quite well.
Comments: More zoom would be nice.

Title: Best Bang for your buck!
Cons: size, doesn't come with rechargable batteries, i dont really like the usb/a/v cover when you have to plug it in. no 60fps at 640x480 video mode.
Pros: excellent quality pics, great zoon, has a good feel, big display, easy to use, records video at 640x480 at 30fps, or 320x240 at 60fps. doesn't feel cheap, a/v output with cable included, iso control, and plenty of other handy features
Comments:
may seem big compared to other cameras that are really slim, but its still small enough to fit in your pocket comfortably.
and first, i bought this to replace a 7mp samsung i got over 2years for $200 wich i thought was steal till about a year and a half later, the it started reading fresh batteries as dead and shut off and that was the end of that camera. this camera takes far clearer pictures, i almost going to get a kodak but after trying that out, i wasn't happy because there too much noise in the pictures so looked to this camera since it had great reviews. 4x zoom, thats bit more that usual in this price range, i don't use digital zoom because i have no use for it when the pictures are already 3xxx by 2xxx. a decent pair of AA batteries last you a good amount of pictures, even after you get the low battery sign, its still good for an even or two.

Title: Love Canon point and shoot cameras
Cons: Not the greatest images in low light. Also would have liked a battery meter or maybe a %life instead of just a low battery warning. Although you can take quite a bit after the warning pops up unlike my old one where you could only take 2-3 more shots.
Pros: Very easy to use. I did own a Canon before but this one has way more features but doesn't get complicated. Never got used to my friends Samsung I used for over a month and I have only had this one a week and it feels familiar. Great pics straight out of the box. Love the video feature and the direct out means I can hook it straight to my TV to watch videos, very cool!
Comments: Great camera for the price. Just having it a week I feel like its paid for itself. Fast UPS 3 day select shipping, can't go wrong with that. Thanks Newegg!

Title: excellent service of shipping ,i really impress
Cons: its memory card but u can buy 1gb of kingstone at low price from newegg.com
Pros: Its easy to use if you read all instruction.light in weight.nice camera with amazing feature.

Title: Quality
Cons: Not really anything to mention. For those looking for a quality digital camera in this price range, this is the camera you are looking for.
Pros: Numerous features and photo quality found in more expensive cameras for a very reasonable price.
Comments: When I was thinking about purchasing the camera, I heard mixed reviews about the case. After holding it I can say it feels durable yet still "plastic"-y and light. I would prefer the comfort and stability of a more durable and denser metal case.

Title: My first camera :S
Cons: The memory card it comes with is only 15mb, which fills up very easily. I got a 1gb card for around $6 though, so that's no problem. Not really anything I can complain about thus far...
Pros: Easy to use, simple to use without the loss of good features. This thing can take some decent size pictures too. Price is excellent and it has a lot of items that came with it in a combo deal around the time I purchased it. Comes with a SD memory card.
Comments: I've only had it for a day and a half now. It's fun to use, and after I managed to bring myself to read the manual, I had a pretty good grip of the features and things. It comes with a wealth of information, including both Basic and Advanced user manuals in English and Spanish. I'd have to recommend it to anyone who was like me, and had little knowledge of what to look for in a camera. It's fun and easy to use, has an excellent price, too.

Title: I love it
Cons: These are not picky, but they are cons. The memory card slot is in with the batteries. This protects it, but also makes it a bit inconvenient to get at. The thing eats batteries (like all digital cameras). I recommend getting a charger (I bought the Powerex one and it works GREAT).
Pros: This camera is really nice. The screen is larger than most cameras, which makes viewing the pictures really nice. It has face recognition. The settings are easy to learn. It auto senses which direction the camera is facing, and will automatically adjust the picture accordingly. It takes nice pictures. It's the best camera I've owned.
Comments: I think it was a great purchase, and it has gotten cheaper since I bought it.

Title: Absolutely wonderful!
Cons: hmm... one time it messed up with detecting the remaining battery life.  But speaking of battery life, it's amazing.  Of course, I've got the rechargeable batteries you can buy with it.
Pros: I got this as a gift, and it's an amazing camera, I totally love it!  I've gotten some really beautiful pics with this baby.
Comments: It's got this awesome face-detection system, so whenever you point the camera at your friends, you see boxes go around their faces, and move along with their faces.  I don't know if it really gives all hat much better of results, but it's hella cool!

Title: Wow!
Cons: Haven't found where to set the resolution for taking pictures. Eats batteries fast. Would like a better microphone for video capturing.
Pros: Takes good pictures. Takes good video. User Interface is easy to use
Comments: Bought this camera before I went on Spring break vacation and I am happy with it so far. I actually paid $149.99 USD for this camera and $24.99 for the PNY 2gb SD card. I love this camera. I mainly use this for video capturing, cause that is one of my hobbys. But I will purchase a video camera for that.

Title: Batteries issue easily solved
Cons:
Had issue with batteries. It would say "replace batteries" almost instantly (in about 30 sec) after putting new batteries in.

No widescreen video (but hey, what do you expect for this price? Just basic features, right?)
Pros:
Cheap camera that takes good pictures.

RMA service was easy and Canon didnt even need any RMA numbers or requests> Just send the camera in with receipt copy and with a short description whats wrong. I Got the camera back already fixed in less than a week. Works good now (still learning how to use it, though)
Comments: I havent had much time to use the camera, I am still learning how to use it. Once I put a couple more months of use on it, I will write a better review.

Title: Excelent Camera
Cons: Sometimes does not flash when it should but does much better than my Kodak p850.
Pros: Does very well with capabilities. Good zoom operation. Good clarity on photos and flash does quite well. Even survived dropping in the snow and getting wet. Face recognition does quite well.
Comments: More zoom would be nice.

Title: Best Bang for your buck!
Cons: size, doesn't come with rechargable batteries, i dont really like the usb/a/v cover when you have to plug it in. no 60fps at 640x480 video mode.
Pros: excellent quality pics, great zoon, has a good feel, big display, easy to use, records video at 640x480 at 30fps, or 320x240 at 60fps. doesn't feel cheap, a/v output with cable included, iso control, and plenty of other handy features
Comments:
may seem big compared to other cameras that are really slim, but its still small enough to fit in your pocket comfortably.
and first, i bought this to replace a 7mp samsung i got over 2years for $200 wich i thought was steal till about a year and a half later, the it started reading fresh batteries as dead and shut off and that was the end of that camera. this camera takes far clearer pictures, i almost going to get a kodak but after trying that out, i wasn't happy because there too much noise in the pictures so looked to this camera since it had great reviews. 4x zoom, thats bit more that usual in this price range, i don't use digital zoom because i have no use for it when the pictures are already 3xxx by 2xxx. a decent pair of AA batteries last you a good amount of pictures, even after you get the low battery sign, its still good for an even or two.

Title: Love Canon point and shoot cameras
Cons: Not the greatest images in low light. Also would have liked a battery meter or maybe a %life instead of just a low battery warning. Although you can take quite a bit after the warning pops up unlike my old one where you could only take 2-3 more shots.
Pros: Very easy to use. I did own a Canon before but this one has way more features but doesn't get complicated. Never got used to my friends Samsung I used for over a month and I have only had this one a week and it feels familiar. Great pics straight out of the box. Love the video feature and the direct out means I can hook it straight to my TV to watch videos, very cool!
Comments: Great camera for the price. Just having it a week I feel like its paid for itself. Fast UPS 3 day select shipping, can't go wrong with that. Thanks Newegg!

Title: My first camera :S
Cons: The memory card it comes with is only 15mb, which fills up very easily. I got a 1gb card for around $6 though, so that's no problem. Not really anything I can complain about thus far...
Pros: Easy to use, simple to use without the loss of good features. This thing can take some decent size pictures too. Price is excellent and it has a lot of items that came with it in a combo deal around the time I purchased it. Comes with a SD memory card.
Comments: I've only had it for a day and a half now. It's fun to use, and after I managed to bring myself to read the manual, I had a pretty good grip of the features and things. It comes with a wealth of information, including both Basic and Advanced user manuals in English and Spanish. I'd have to recommend it to anyone who was like me, and had little knowledge of what to look for in a camera. It's fun and easy to use, has an excellent price, too.

Title: I love it
Cons: These are not picky, but they are cons. The memory card slot is in with the batteries. This protects it, but also makes it a bit inconvenient to get at. The thing eats batteries (like all digital cameras). I recommend getting a charger (I bought the Powerex one and it works GREAT).
Pros: This camera is really nice. The screen is larger than most cameras, which makes viewing the pictures really nice. It has face recognition. The settings are easy to learn. It auto senses which direction the camera is facing, and will automatically adjust the picture accordingly. It takes nice pictures. It's the best camera I've owned.
Comments: I think it was a great purchase, and it has gotten cheaper since I bought it.

Title: Absolutely wonderful!
Cons: hmm... one time it messed up with detecting the remaining battery life.  But speaking of battery life, it's amazing.  Of course, I've got the rechargeable batteries you can buy with it.
Pros: I got this as a gift, and it's an amazing camera, I totally love it!  I've gotten some really beautiful pics with this baby.
Comments: It's got this awesome face-detection system, so whenever you point the camera at your friends, you see boxes go around their faces, and move along with their faces.  I don't know if it really gives all hat much better of results, but it's hella cool!

Title: Wow!
Cons: Haven't found where to set the resolution for taking pictures. Eats batteries fast. Would like a better microphone for video capturing.
Pros: Takes good pictures. Takes good video. User Interface is easy to use
Comments: Bought this camera before I went on Spring break vacation and I am happy with it so far. I actually paid $149.99 USD for this camera and $24.99 for the PNY 2gb SD card. I love this camera. Comments: I think it was a great purchase, and it has gotten cheaper since I bought it.

Title: Absolutely wonderful!
Cons: hmm... one time it messed up with detecting the remaining battery life.  But speaking of battery life, it's amazing.  Of course, I've got the rechargeable batteries you can buy with it.
Pros: I got this as a gift, and it's an amazing camera, I totally love it!  I've gotten some really beautiful pics with this baby.
Comments: It's got this awesome face-detection system, so whenever you point the camera at your friends, you see boxes go around their faces, and move along with their faces.  I don't know if it really gives all hat much better of results, but it's hella cool!

Title: Wow!
Cons: Haven't found where to set the resolution for taking pictures. Eats batteries fast. Would like a better microphone for video capturing.
Pros: Takes good pictures. Takes good video. User Interface is easy to use
Comments: Bought this camera before I went on Spring break vacation and I am happy with it so far. I actually paid $149.99 USD for this camera and $24.99 for the PNY 2gb SD card. I love this camera. I mainly use this for video capturing, cause that is one of my hobbys. But I will purchase a video camera for that.

Title: Batteries issue easily solved
Cons:
Had issue with batteries. It would say "replace batteries" almost instantly (in about 30 sec) after putting new batteries in.

No widescreen video (but hey, what do you expect for this price? Just basic features, right?)
Pros:
Cheap camera that takes good pictures.

RMA service was easy and Canon didnt even need any RMA numbers or requests> Just send the camera in with receipt copy and with a short description whats wrong. I Got the camera back already fixed in less than a week. Works good now (still learning how to use it, though)
Comments: I havent had much time to use the camera, I am still learning how to use it. Once I put a couple more months of use on it, I will write a better review.

Title: Excelent Camera
Cons: Sometimes does not flash when it should but does much better than my Kodak p850.
Pros: Does very well with capabilities. Good zoom operation. Good clarity on photos and flash does quite well. Even survived dropping in the snow and getting wet. Face recognition does quite well.
Comments: More zoom would be nice.

Title: Best Bang for your buck!
Cons: size, doesn't come with rechargable batteries, i dont really like the usb/a/v cover when you have to plug it in. no 60fps at 640x480 video mode.
Pros: excellent quality pics, great zoon, has a good feel, big display, easy to use, records video at 640x480 at 30fps, or 320x240 at 60fps. doesn't feel cheap, a/v output with cable included, iso control, and plenty of other handy features
Comments:
may seem big compared to other cameras that are really slim, but its still small enough to fit in your pocket comfortably.
and first, i bought this to replace a 7mp samsung i got over 2years for $200 wich i thought was steal till about a year and a half later, the it started reading fresh batteries as dead and shut off and that was the end of that camera. this camera takes far clearer pictures, i almost going to get a kodak but after trying that out, i wasn't happy because there too much noise in the pictures so looked to this camera since it had great reviews. 4x zoom, thats bit more that usual in this price range, i don't use digital zoom because i have no use for it when the pictures are already 3xxx by 2xxx. a decent pair of AA batteries last you a good amount of pictures, even after you get the low battery sign, its still good for an even or two.

Title: Love Canon point and shoot cameras
Cons: Not the greatest images in low light. Also would have liked a battery meter or maybe a %life instead of just a low battery warning. Although you can take quite a bit after the warning pops up unlike my old one where you could only take 2-3 more shots.
Pros: Very easy to use. I did own a Canon before but this one has way more features but doesn't get complicated. Never got used to my friends Samsung I used for over a month and I have only had this one a week and it feels familiar. Great pics straight out of the box. Love the video feature and the direct out means I can hook it straight to my TV to watch videos, very cool!
Comments: Great camera for the price. Just having it a week I feel like its paid for itself. Fast UPS 3 day select shipping, can't go wrong with that. Thanks Newegg!

Title: excellent service of shipping ,i really impress
Cons: its memory card but u can buy 1gb of kingstone at low price from newegg.com
Pros: Its easy to use if you read all instruction.light in weight.nice camera with amazing feature.

Title: Quality
Cons: Not really anything to mention. For those looking for a quality digital camera in this price range, this is the camera you are looking for.
Pros: Numerous features and photo quality found in more expensive cameras for a very reasonable price.
Comments: When I was thinking about purchasing the camera, I heard mixed reviews about the case. After holding it I can say it feels durable yet still "plastic"-y and light. I would prefer the comfort and stability of a more durable and denser metal case.

Title: My first camera :S
Cons: The memory card it comes with is only 15mb, which fills up very easily. I got a 1gb card for around $6 though, so that's no problem. Not really anything I can complain about thus far...
Pros: Easy to use, simple to use without the loss of good features. This thing can take some decent size pictures too. Price is excellent and it has a lot of items that came with it in a combo deal around the time I purchased it. Comes with a SD memory card.
Comments: I've only had it for a day and a half now. It's fun to use, and after I managed to bring myself to read the manual, I had a pretty good grip of the features and things. It comes with a wealth of information, including both Basic and Advanced user manuals in English and Spanish. I'd have to recommend it to anyone who was like me, and had little knowledge of what to look for in a camera. It's fun and easy to use, has an excellent price, too.

Title: I love it
Cons: These are not picky, but they are cons. The memory card slot is in with the batteries. This protects it, but also makes it a bit inconvenient to get at. The thing eats batteries (like all digital cameras). I recommend getting a charger (I bought the Powerex one and it works GREAT).
Pros: This camera is really nice. The screen is larger than most cameras, which makes viewing the pictures really nice. It has face recognition. The settings are easy to learn. It auto senses which direction the camera is facing, and will automatically adjust the picture accordingly. It takes nice pictures. It's the best camera I've owned.
Comments: I think it was a great purchase, and it has gotten cheaper since I bought it.

Title: Absolutely wonderful!
Cons: hmm... one time it messed up with detecting the remaining battery life.  But speaking of battery life, it's amazing.  Of course, I've got the rechargeable batteries you can buy with it.
